title: Introduction
footer_content:
[nv]In the footnote, it says that the amount here MUST match the order value.
How does this work when there is a discount provided by the Buyer App?
The payment collected by the BAP may not always be equal to the order value specified by the BPP.
Do we always expect this field to be set to the full order value?
[nw]discount from buyer app is between them & buyer; order value should be same as what the seller has quoted
[nx]@supriyo@ondc.org are this field mandatory or optional for BAP
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[ny]required
[nz]@supriyo@ondc.org Validation check for TAT (based on /on_select) may not be required as TAT may change from on_select to on_confirm:
1. Due to rush hours
2. Change in LSPs (due to unavailability of few LSPs, which were earlier available during on_select but not during on_confirm)
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[oa]agree, will address
[ob]@supriyo@ondc.org
Could you pls explain use case for this location_address as we are already using the address received during on_search for the location
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[oc]agree, but this is the recorded copy of the order; hence, the provider address is also included
[od]Is there a possibility of having multiple instructions? If yes, then please provide a capability to provide multiple instructions
[oe]Hi @supriyo@ondc.org ,Is there any length restrictions for "phone" ?Is more than one number allowed?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[of]1 number of 10 digits
[og]Are these attributes are mandatory or optional for phase 1 implementation?
[oh]yes, this should be sent with static terms enablement
[oi]why is it required for ISN seller NP when gst number is already captured
[oj]for the buyer NP to match SNP PAN with seller PAN & verify this is actually an ISN so that they can deduct GST
[ok]We are having contract for part cancel by merchant. But part cancel by buyer app can also be a case.  So, in that case /update will start from buyer app. Does ONDC supports part cancel by buyer??? If it is contract doesn't mention about part cancel by buyer.
[ol]Is partial cancellation of item using fulfilment based action part of phase 1?
it will require whole fulfilment revamp at buyer side. customisation and fulfilment based changes should be phased out.
means until fulfilment changes doesn't go part cancellation of customisation should be happening via 1.1 contract
[om]@supriyo@ondc.org can we please have code: parent_item_id, value: parent_item_id_value  as well for customization cases ? (makes cross field linking easier for customizied items which share a lot of common customizations )
[on]parent_item_id would be the dynamic item id or customization group id? value would be?
[oo]this would be the dynamic item id
[op]will add
[oq]Is there support for part cancellation by the buyer?
[or]_Marked as resolved_
[os]_Re-opened_
[ot]is the buyer partial cancellation supported?
[ou]what's the usecase for this?
[ov]Please consider return cancel use cases as well as discussed
[ow]yes, will be adding for phase 2
[ox]@supriyo@ondc.org
Will there be more than one return request initiated from a single /update call ?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[oy]yes, separate return request (with unique id) per item
[oz]@supriyo@ondc.org: Should we be passing dynamic_item_id in case of item containing customisations?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[pa]make-to-order items, i.e. with customizations, aren't returnable
[pb]What about a genuine case?
like package was torn (for return),
items are missing.
[pc]@supriyo@ondc.org:  is there any minimum ttl_approval defined because buyer can send 1 or 2 hours as ttl_approval ?
also for ttl_Reverseqc,
`reverse qc should be completed within the return window`
what if the return request raised on last day of return window?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[pd]Valid point. For now, seller NP can NACK return request if ttl_approval / ttl_reverseqc is impractical & this will have to get resolved through IGM
[pe]@supriyo@ondc.org - sending NACK because of ttl_approval / ttl_reverseqc as per Seller App say is higher, would lead to a situation where Buyer Apps wont be able to create a ''Return'' because through IGM orderflow states couldnt be managed
Please advise
[pf]in most cases, buyer app will request realistic values for these TAT, so the normal flow should work; for unrealistic TATs (e.g. 30 min for approval), what other option does the seller app have other than NACK (probably with option to suggest realistic values)?
[pg]@supriyo@ondc.org  Under Return > Tags > List >code: "id" & parent_Item_id  in the List is missing in few On_updates.  Its present in the liquidation flow with On_update.  example return_request & return request_initiated.  Its better on_update List object to be consistent across all the flows alteast under the return section.   & the same Tag objects  be used at On_status part of the respective fulfilment.
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[ph]id is required in the Order, parent_item_id won't be there for most cases;
[pi]@supriyo@ondc.org
Is all the reverse QC inputs mandatory?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[pj]no - this is only when BNP is handling fulfillment as LBNP
[pk]@supriyo@ondc.org
Then how to keep the buyer updated about the Reverse QC process?
[pl]buyer can see the status - return picked / rejected & reason code for rejection
[pm]@akshay@wemotiveforge.com
Why this is added in params? Do we need to send Ans in this?As per log validation it is saying no need to write? What is purpose too add?
[pn]@supriyo@ondc.org ,   What are the possible Value options for Q001.   If the value is "".  Does it indicate, shippers/LSP to check the name & Qty ?    .  What other values can come here.
[po]@supriyo@ondc.org The Reason codes sheet does not include return pickup failed reasons and their codes. What codes should we use
cc:- @nimitshah@gofynd.com
[pp]check the updated link in footnote
[pq]@supriyo@ondc.org  Correct me if I am wrong , The "Reason code" sheet does not include reason codes specifically for return pickup failed, the Pickup Failure sheet resembles to "order pick up" failure only
[pr]check "Return Rejection (pickup failure)" in the sheet
[ps]If return failed then why is count 1, shouldn't it be 2 i.e the initial count?
[pt]correct
[pu]If item is lost in return shipment, then we will never get return deliver to merchant status, which we need to send to buyer based on Api contract. So, is it mandatory to send the return delivered to merchant or not? If it is mandated, then we have to send that on shipment lost status. If not mandate, then after picked up we will not send return delivered to merchant in lost case scenario.
Please confirm and update us.
[pv]correct - in this case, no Return-Delivered can be sent;
[pw]@supriyo@ondc.org
1] In the buyer app i can see multiple return request can be raised for the same item with different return ids for each request received? Is this expected?
2] If a single return request is raised for more than one items will the return id be different or same?
Please help me understand
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[px]1. a. If there are multiple qty for an item, you can raise separate return request for diff qty for same item;
b. If a return request is rejected once, you can re-raise the return request (with diff id), within the return window;
2. If there are different items, you should raise separate return request for each item as the return window / merchant authorization duration may be different for each item; only exception is for F&B where items & customizations, that are part of same dynamic item, can be a part of the same return request (with single id);
[py]@supriyo@ondc.org Thanks for the reply. I totally agree with your point.
I still have a doubt regarding how the buyer app ONDC is working in the current scenario.
So as you mentioned separate return request for different quantity and re-raising the return request  if its rejected with different return ids are perfect.
Actually what I am facing in the buyer application is -
Different return id generated for the same item with exact same qty of the previous return request even though no rejection response sent from our side.
Please help me with understanding this concept
[pz]item I1 with 2 qty: I can send 2 return requests (with separate ids) for i1, qty 1;
each of these requests will have separate merchant authorization;
is this what's happening?
[qa]No actually I ordered I1 with 2 quantities now i am able to raise more than one return request for same I1 with 2 qty. i.e.
1st request - I1 Qty2 return_id = "1234"
2nd request - I1 Qty2 return_id ="5678"
this goes on an on i can keep on raising multiple return requests for the same item with the whole quantity and each time the return id we receive is different.
[qb]considering that these are stateless APIs, buyer app will send the return requests with distinct ids to seller but seller will only accept one & reject the others
[qc]Thanks @supriyo@ondc.org
So accepting the most recent return request and rejecting the previously received one works right?
[qd]yes, you can reject the other(s) return request with reason code "008"
[qe]@supriyo@ondc.org: This could be DI1 too? (in case of dynamic item)
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[qf]make-to-order items, i.e. with customizations, aren't returnable
[qg]How is the breach of this SLA handled?
Does the Buyer NP assume that it was accepted? If yes, how does the Buyer NP indicate this to the Seller NP?
[qh]Can this Approval TTL be overwritten by the Seller NP in the /on_update?
If not, how can we ensure that it takes into account the operating hours of the location/merchant?
[qi]@supriyo@ondc.org
Can multiple items be sent for one Liquidated Fulfillment?
suppose A was liquidated at t1
and B was liquidated at t2
can they both come under one Liduidated fulfillment R1 with 2 return_request params in tags.
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[qj]return request should be sent in separate fulfillments, unless this is for make-to-order item in which case, the items & customizations need to be processed together;
[qk]@supriyo@ondc.org bap_id or bap_uri has to be sent here. CC : @uttam.nagaraj@paytm.com
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[ql]wherever the request originated from; in this case - bap_id
[qm]@supriyo@ondc.org
There is a difference between quote_trail in ON_cancel & On_update. Interms of  "subtype".   Is this mandatory only for on_update. ?   please confirm.
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[qn]In the case of the cancellation of multiple items, how should we send multiple item IDs?
@supriyo@ondc.org
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[qo]there will be separate array entry for each item
[qp]So mean to say that there will be array in list again with the multiple ids.  list[[id1][id2]] like this?
[qq]The cancellation terms defined in the on_init is valid for all on_cancel responses?
Will quote trails have the list of all the deducted values and cancellation fees? So it can also be used to check this condition?
[qr]check the force cancellation flow below
[qs]@supriyo@ondc.org this order state should be canceled
Also, on_cancel should be sent when RTO has been completed. For the rto_initiated update, it should not come in on_cancel right?
BAP won't be able to take multiple on_cancel for rto-state updates.
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[qt]@supriyo@ondc.org As there are two fulfillments for same item in this example, but we need to identify the active fulfillment (to fetch the live state of the fulfillment and to fetch the cancellation_reason_code)
For this, Could we take the fulfillment with count > 0 (for identifying the active fuflillment)?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[qu]@supriyo@ondc.org
Should we be checking fulfillments for fetching following information (In all scenarios for on_cancel flow i.e. customer_cancelled, merchant_cancelled, LSP_cancelled):
1. state of the fulfillment
2. cancellation_reason_code
[qv]@supriyo@ondc.org
should the timestamp in the end and start be the same in case of RTO-Initiated?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[qw]start - for RTO-Initiated;
end - for RTO-Delivered / RTO-Disposed
[qx]on_cancel is called when RTO is initialized. So in that case we wont be sending end timestamp, right? Wont this be always the case since for RTo-delivered, I have to call on_status. So end timestamp in on_cancel will always be empty.
[qy]end timestamp is for terminal state of RTO (RTO-Delivered, RTO-Disposed), for which you need to send this value;
[qz]But for RTO-Delivered & RTO-Disposed i send on_status response do I need to send  on_cancel again. Flow is on_cancel->on_status.
[ra]correct, but /on_status needs to have this value;
fyi, /on_status, /on_cancel, /on_update return the current copy of the order; generally /on_status is used as backup for both /on_cancel & /on_update;
[rb]so i will be sending end timestamp in on_status only which follows on_cancel
[rc]@supriyo@ondc.org For tax type will be "tax" or "delivery"
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[rd]"tax"
[re]@supriyo@ondc.org As discussed:
In case of 0% cancellation (max refund to user):
1. fulfillment.tags.quote_details will contain all the price bifurcation (on_confirm.breakup) with negative sign.
2. quote.breakup will be similar to on_confirm.breakup but with as all value will be Zero (except for the unit price for item).
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[rf]@supriyo@ondc.org as discussed:
In case of 100% cancellation (zero refund to user)
1. fulfillment.tags.quote_details will be empty
2. quote.breakup will be /on_confirm.breakup
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[rg]@supriyo@ondc.org - If OTP has to be communicated to Buyer, Is the Seller NP supposed to send this in every on_status call after the order has been picked up?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[rh]this could be generated anytime between order pickup & delivery; considering that this is stateless API, this has to be sent in every /on_status;
[ri]@supriyo@ondc.org - What if the OTP was provided in on_status but was not used at the time of  delivery? Can the Buyer App use this as a Proof of delivery?
[rj]authorization of OTP is proof of delivery; if not used, there's no authorization, hence no proof
[rk]@supriyo@ondc.org - There are cases where we are getting OTP in on_status during 'Out for delivery' state, but not during 'Delivered' state. So, in this case, can we still consider the OTP as proof of delivery?
[rl]depends on whether SNP (also LBNP in this case) has verified OTP at the time of delivery
[rm]@supriyo@ondc.org what is the format we should expect for invoice url?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[rn]Does this URL stored at buyer side? or seller needs to provide every time when /status call?
[ro]@supriyo@ondc.org here in invoice  this particular invoice is for the buyer app or the end buyer
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[rp]seller invoice for buyer
[rq]Hi @supriyo@ondc.org,
What does this created_at & updated_at mean by. We receive error as "Updated At Date is greater than Context Timestamp" from pramaan and needs to understand what we should pass here.
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[rr]created_at - when order object created in /confirm;
updated_at - last update timestamp; obviously this can't be future dated wrt Context.timestamp;
[rs]Hi @supriyo@ondc.org
We have a credit note based functionality so we would like to attach one more document which highlights the refund details in that document. Can we add it in this document section? or we are just supposed to send only one document.
[rt]while you can send multiple docs (note this is array), currently it's being used to send the seller invoice to buyer;
need to understand the exact use case for refund - if it's due to part-cancel (of item), you can send /on_update (as per contract) & if it's due to change in price post-confirm, you can send /on_status & the buyer NP is required to refund;
when exactly is credit note being used?
[ru]Hi @supriyo@ondc.org so we have a scenario where customer can partially accept the order at the door step so in that case we refund the customer for which we generate a credit note with the details of the undelivered items
[rv]this will work if you part cancel the undelivered items (with reason code 002) and attach the credit note; curious though, as to where / how you see the buyer using the credit note?
[rw]From where those dates comes from?/confirm,/on_confirm or any other API.
[rx]created_at & updated_at- buyer app sets it when calling /confirm with order id;
updated_at - updated by seller app whenever order state changes
[ry]Hi @supriyo@ondc.org,
Does all the status of fulfillment State provided in below table, is mandatory to sent by LSP partner in case of P2H2P.
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[rz]yes
[sa]@supriyo@ondc.org Is there no discount on the fulfillment level?
Also, discount at the order level will come under offer?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[sb]you can use offers - check 5.2
[sc]and CONVENIENCE_CHARGE is under fulfillment?
[sd]yes, it's called "misc"
[se]What is the default value for item in stock? Need clarification on available/count and maximum/count. @supriyo.ondc.org
[sf]default value for item in stock - "99", out of stock - "0"
[sg]Is it same for on_select and on_init api?
[sh]@supriyo@ondc.org
[si]yes - for /on_select; this isn't in /on_init
[sj]@supriyo@ondc.org.   Would like to confirm if these changes are applicable for Quote /breakup in all the API methods like on_select, on_cancel,  quote_trail as well ?    Need clarity on what exactly can be included.  As sellers have conditions based on the order value the  delivery charges may become free.   and also there is a change in Ph1 and final v1.2.0ph2 doc.    1;  Can we use the below summary for all the APIs ?   2.  pls confirm 2, 3 & 5 specifically from below;    3.  Can we use the same behaviour in the quote_trail as well.  Please suggest.  Quote/break up/ overall Snip:
• 1] packing charge to be included only if not 0;
• 2] tax breakup to be included only if tax is not 0; (but in on_cancel example, item with "0" value is shown. Is it a exemption for On_cancel ?)
• 3] discount to be included only if not 0; (condition not present in v1.2.0 Phase 2 doc.  Assuming can be included even if its zero.)
• 4] misc to be included only if not 0;
• 5] delivery charge to be included only if fulfillment state code is "Serviceable";  (ie include if its zero as well)
6] current: Phase 2 doc: tax on fulfillment level charges, to be included only if not 0 (i.e. logistics buyer NP provides tax inclusive fulfillment level charges);
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[sk]quote can have all line items (including of 0 value);
quote_trail should only include the delta changes from the current order quote;
[sl]@supriyo@ondc.org.   We are aiming at v1.2.0Ph1 seller NP as production, and this  suggestion should work for both v1.2.0 Ph1 and v1.2.0 Ph2 for all Buyerapps .  Please confirm
[sm]shall we consider adding 'egg' for grocery also. as few items may have 'egg only' tags
ex: mayonnaise, wondercake
@Supriyo@ondc.org
_Assigned to Supriyo@ondc.org_
[sn]you can certainly add the veg/non-veg tag for these items
[so]Attribute keys not available for Grocery Or F&B. Where to check?
@supriyo@ondc.org
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[sp]keys are defined for grocery; no standard keys can be defined for f&b
[sq]In case of RTO-Disposed can we send only this status. Or is it necessary to send RTO-Intiated also? @supriyo@ondc.org
[sr]@supriyo@ondc.org - does the github repository comprising of suggestive enums need to be considered as an exhaustive list and if any seller NP sends any enums other than the ones defined here, do we need to reject them?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[ss]most are suggestive, i.e. not exhaustive; some like UOM (used in item.quantity.unitized.measure.unit) is exhaustive;
[st]@supriyo@ondc.org - wouldn't this lead to limitations due to payload size if we don't consider pagination?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[su]@supriyo@ondc.org This sheet does not cover all the pincodes, what should be done for missing pincodes?
[sv]pls share the list of missing pincodes (as per this format) & we'll add it
[sw]@supriyo@ondc.org  PF pincodes with missing std codes
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1i4DAj0QLK_ERivPZ-rZV4Ve8vuMNZayposIGOvkOgTE/edit?usp=sharing
[sx]Is it a hard constraint can we have both numbers and special characters only like 112_34.
I am asking this because few NP's are sending NACK because of this issue.
@supriyo@ondc.org
[sy]some chars like ":" should work
[sz]@supriyo.ondc.org
For customisations, error.message  should be
"[{dynamic_item_id:DI1,item_id:I1}, {dynamic_item_id:DI2,customization_id:C15,customization_group_id:CG3}]"
for non-customizations it is mentioned as "i1,i2,i3"
1)what if the cart has both customization and Non-customization items?
can you make a common format for both?
[ta]@supriyo.ondc.org can you please update on this?
cc: @rohit.singh@phonepe.com
[tb]this is the format we've thought of:
[
{
"dynamic_item_id":"DI1",
"item_id":"I1",
"customization_group_id":"CG3",
"customization_id":"C15",
"error":"40002"
}
]
will update with examples
[tc]Does this works only for multiple items which are out of stock?
[td]item out of stock, disabled, etc
[te]This comment will not be applicable here correct? The pointed doc contains attribute tag for BPC, key mapping is only present for grocery. @supriyo@ondc.org  can you confirm
[tf]@supriyo@ondc.org,
The type is based on category or anything else, Or can we pass 5 for all.?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[tg]How do we check this ? if name is house no/door no, is this value will be expected to be integer ?
[th]not necessarily
[ti]Link no longer exists
[tj]updated
[tk]@supriyo@ondc.org this one is end.time.range.start and end.time.range.end, right?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[tl]correct
[tm]Is it a hard constraint can we have both numbers and special characters only like 112_34.
I am asking this because few NP's are sending NACK because of this issue.
@supriyo@ondc.org
[tn]some chars like ":" should work

- day of week (\"1\" - Monday, \"7\" - S: select" (selection by buyer from available customizations based on min/max)
text" (text entered by buyer e.g. for engraving);
will enable better discoverability on bu: select" (selection by buyer from available customizations based on min/max)
text" (text entered by buyer e.g. for engraving);

definitions.So: to say that there will be array in list again with the multiple ids.  list[[id1][id2]] like this?
definitions.updated_at: by. We receive error as "Updated At Date is greater than Context Timestamp" from pramaan and needs to understand what we should pass here.
definitions.NACK: refresh couldn’t be ingested and could happen because the incremental refresh being shared for specific provider(s) / location(s) / item(s) are not found on the buyer NP cache or for other reasons. Buyer NP should use these error codes / message in the NACK response:
definitions.above: preference is to display this menu item from Monday to Friday from 1800 to 2200; if not specified, indicates preference for displaying this menu item as per store timings;
definitions.which: the store will automatically reopen after the given time in buyer app. Is that correct ?
definitions.this: as how max buyer can order?
definitions.types: and when they are to be used?
definitions.is: by settlement_phase? What would be possible values?
definitions.for: the provider, of type "custom_group" for this id;
definitions.of: min_value applicable: Cart total inclusive of shipping charges?
definitions.template: there is no example of such offer type and it closely matches with flat offer types based on cart value. This Free delivery type offers should be sent in on_search as well ?? And if it is it's body should match with which kind of offers?? Since there is item_ids field also present. So should we keep it is as empty or should we not include it ??, because it's impractical to send thousands of item id's for free delivery type of offer.
definitions.including: id, name, min / max, input type, sequence of display;
definitions.in: /on_search is to enable buyer apps to publish these offers for the seller;
definitions.will: be different for each of these categories
